page.title: 02A Burgess Hill Footpath
page.content: There is a footpath on the west side of{Ditchling Common.}It starts at Ditchling Stud Farm, passes Freckborough Manor, and continues to Folders Lane. The path is marked on old maps, but over the last few years it has become somewhat overgrown. At the northern end there is a lot of{elder}and{blackthorn.}Towards the southern end the main tree is the{oak. Ditchling Common also has many flowers.{Bluebells}line the walk in May. In July we found over 50 species, including{English rose, dog rose, {stinging nettles, woundwort, tufted {vetch, hogweed, dyer's greenweed, {ox-eye daisy, yarrow}and{bird's foot {trefoil. Water parsnip}grows in the ditches. {Blue and brown butterflies}and{blue {damselflies}are to be seen in summer.
